name: Muhammad Haris Rehman
event_review: It was most detailed and comprehensive session ever
answer1: Forking is simply a copy of a repository that allows to freely experiment with changes without affecting the original project ,Cloning is when I create a new repository on GitHub, it exists as a remote location where my project is stored. I can clone my repository to create a local copy on my computer so that I can sync between both the local and remote locations of the project.And when I fork I won’t be able to pull down changes from the original repository I cloned from, and if the project is owned by someone else I won’t be able to contribute back to it.
answer2: In Pull request let me tell others about changes I've pushed to a branch in a repository on GitHub. Once a pull request is opened, I can discuss and review the potential changes with collaborators.Pushing is how you transfer commits from your local repository to a remote repo
